question_text: A technician tries to install DDR4 memory into a DDR3-compatible motherboard, but the module doesn't fit. Why?
answer_options: The DIMM is incompatible due to different notch positions
The voltage regulator needs to be disabled first
The CPU socket must be changed to support newer memory
correct_answer: The DIMM is incompatible due to different notch positions
explanation: Even though both are DIMMs, DDR3 and DDR4 have differently positioned notches to prevent incorrect installation.
